pr_title: rls: fake direct scheduled executor supports schedule

timeline.message: rls: add invalidate(Key,Value), move out fake direct scheduled executor

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: yes, i didn't really consider the access ordering. thanks
replies.author: creamsoup

replies.bodyText: unfortunately the replace is java8 api. doesn't seem like there is a good option for java7
replies.author: creamsoup

replies.bodyText: Maybe leave here a TODO with rationale on access ordering and java7 restriction.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: i am trying to remove this method. and make the caller work around this problem.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.bodyText: Seems every method of DoNotUseDirectScheduledExecutorService calls maybeInit(), why not just init these fields directly at their declaration and remove maybeInit().
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: this was due to the CALLS_REAL_METHODS doesn't initialize instance variables. comment will be added.
replies.author: creamsoup
dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: the only reason i didn't implement scheduleAtFixedRate is i don't need it. it can be added if we need. also supporting multiple scheduled tasks is not hard. just don't need it at this point.
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.message: prevent instantiation for fake scheduled executor

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: If you really want ThreadSafe, isCancelled() and isDone() also need synchronized.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: yeah removing it makes sense. making it thread safe requires little more work, but it is really meant to be "direct".
replies.author: creamsoup

timeline.bodyText: If you really want to support callers from multiple threads without caller's synchronization, other methods also need synchronized. As javadoc says implementation is not thread-safe,  so synchronized is not necessary.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0
